name: Delhi
description: India's capital city, home to Mughal architecture, world-class street food, and 174 protected heritage monuments.

name: Jaipur
description: The Pink City — Rajasthan's capital, known for its forts, palaces, textile traditions, and vibrant bazaars.

name: Mumbai
description: India's financial capital and Bollywood's home, where colonial-era architecture meets street food culture.

name: Goa
description: India's smallest state, known for Portuguese heritage, beaches, spice plantations, and seafood.

name: Varanasi
description: One of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities, the spiritual heart of Hinduism on the banks of the Ganges.

name: Udaipur
description: The City of Lakes — Rajasthan's most romantic destination with palatial architecture and miniature painting traditions.

name: Agra
description: Home to the Taj Mahal, Agra Fort, and a street food scene centred around petha and chaat.

name: Kolkata
description: The cultural capital of India — literature, cinema, art, and arguably the country's best street food.

name: Kerala
description: God's Own Country — backwaters, Ayurveda, spice gardens, and Kerala cuisine.

name: Rishikesh
description: The yoga capital of the world, set on the Ganges in the Himalayan foothills.
